Title: Practice: image processing and analysis
Creator: ['Stefan Lang']
Publisher: University of Salzburg
Abstract: This introductory course in remote sensing and (satellite) image analysis covers the basic analysis workflow. It requires a lecture or any other introductory class in the theoretical fundamentals of remote sensing
Description: Learning outcomes: Understand remote sensing workflow including image acquisition, (pixel-based) image analysis, classification and validation; get to know online portals, data catalogues, and pricing schemes for satellite data; Familiarize with the European Copernicus Earth observation programme; Master standard image analysis routines as implemented in ArcGIS Pro

Title: Terrascope Application Development
Creator: ['VITO - Vlaamse Instelling voor Technologisch Onderzoek']
Publisher: VITO - Vlaamse Instelling voor Technologisch Onderzoek
Abstract: This slide set provides an overview of how researchers or students could utilize Terrascope Jupyter notebooks and web services API such as openEO to develop remote sensing algorithms and applications
Description: Learning outcomes: Understand Terrascope development environments including Jupyter notebooks; Develop a simple application, step-by-step, using Terrascope and OpenEO API; Analyse Phenology Use Case implementation as an advanced exercise

Title: Accessing EO Data Using Terrascope Platform
Creator: ['VITO - Vlaamse Instelling voor Technologisch Onderzoek']
Publisher: VITO - Vlaamse Instelling voor Technologisch Onderzoek
Abstract: This training material provides an overview of 'Terrascope', which is one of the EO platforms that are being used within EO4GEO project. With this material, you can familiarize yourself with Terrascope and learn how to access to the data and process it.
Description: Learning outcomes: Identify different types of Copernicus satellite data and derived products available on Terrascope Platform; Compare various Terrascope tools and methods that can be leveraged to access and process data; Demonstrate understanding of the platform by performing the instructions to access the Copernicus data

Title: The EO4GEO project
Creator: ['Roderic Molina']
Publisher: GISIG
Abstract:
This is a brief introductory presentation to the Erasmus+ EO4GEO project. 
													EO4GEO is an Erasmus+ Sector Skills Alliance gathering 26 partners from 13 EU countries.
													EO4GEO aims to help bridging the skills gap in the space/geospatial sector by creating a strong alliance of players from the sector/community reinforcing the existing ecosystem and fostering the uptake and integration of space/geospatial data and services

Title: Urban Heat Islands
Creator: ['Veronika Krieger']
Publisher: Spatial Services GmbH
Abstract: This slideset is a tutorial for a basic analysis of urban heat islands. Within the tutorial SNAP, QGIS and eCognition are used.
Description: Learning outcomes: Interpret EO-derived temperature maps; Identify local heat islands; See how different land cover affects temperature; Understand how urban-scale weather/climate information may be usefully employed at urban management

Title: Identification of local heat islands to support city planning - Understanding the concept of EO time series
Creator: ['Marijan Grgic, mgrgic@geof.hr']
Publisher: University of Zagreb, Faculty of Geodesy
Abstract: This is a lesson on monitoring the urban heat islands. This beginner's lesson introduces the student to remote sensing
Description: Design and develop methods for local heat islands detection to support city planning, Understand basics of RS/EO/GI knowledge, Identify RS methods for dummies

Title: Identification of local heat islands to support city planning - Basic GIS knowledge vector and raster data
Creator: ['Marijan Grgic, mgrgic@geof.hr']
Publisher: University of Zagreb, Faculty of Geodesy
Abstract: This is a lesson on monitoring the urban heat islands. This beginner's lesson introduces the student to GIS and vector/raster data
Description: Design and develop methods for local heat islands detection to support city planning, Understand basics of RS/EO/GI knowledge, Modify spatial data, Understand GIS vector and raster data, Identify RS methods for dummies

Title: Copernicus Service - Land
Creator: ['Andrija Krtalic']
Publisher: University of Zagreb, Faculty of Geodesy
Abstract: This is a lesson on Copernicus Services for land monitoring.

Title: Validation of EO Products
Creator: ['Andrija Krtalic']
Publisher: University of Zagreb, Faculty of Geodesy
Abstract: This is a lesson on Validation of EO products

Title: Preprocessing of EO Data
Creator: ['Andrija Krtalic']
Publisher: University of Zagreb, Faculty of Geodesy
Abstract: This is a lesson on Copernicus Services for land monitoring.
Description: Learning outcomes: Understand the Copernicus ecosystem and services; perform simple analysis with Jupyter Notebook; Understand Copernicus Climate Change Service

Title: Classification: Random Forests
Creator: ['Mariana Belgiu', 'Anurag Kulshrestha']
Publisher: University of Twente
Abstract: This teaching unit is dedicated to introducing Random Forests ensemble classifier.

Title: Classification: Decision Trees
Creator: ['Mariana Belgiu']
Publisher: Faculty of Geo-Information Science and Earth Observation (ITC), University of Twente
Abstract: Decision Trees

Title: Introduction to GIS
Creator: ['Anna Adamowicz']
Publisher: UNEP/GRID-Warsaw Centre
Abstract: This is an introductory course to GIS including basic information on: Geographic Information System, spatial data (raster and vector model), coordinate systems, attribute and spatial queries, simple analysis using geoprocessing tools, and data visualization
Description: Learning outcomes: Understand the basic concepts of Geographic Information Systems; Define terms related to raster and vector data models (e.g. pixel, grid, spatial resolution, attribute table, topology); Compare vector and raster data models; Understand the difference between geographic and projected coordinate systems; Select objects using attribute and spatial queries; Perform simple analysis with geoprocessing tools; List map elements and basic principles of map creation; Create a thematic map using different methods of symbolization;

Title: Training module on SDI Architecture and SDI components
Creator: ['Marc Olijslagers', 'Danny Vandenbroucke', 'Maria da Saudade De Brito Pontes']
Abstract:
Spatial data are widely used in public and private organisations. However, the data are often difficult to find, access, use and combine. Spatial data infrastructures (SDI) are a solution to this lack of accessibility and interoperability. An SDI is a set of technological and non-technological components meant to facilitate access, exchange and re-use of geospatial data within and between organisations.
			The module introduces the concept of SDIs and explains the rationale behind it. It explains the  different technical and non-technical components of an SDI: data, services, metadata, standards, technology, organisational and institutional aspects (people), etc. and how the technological components work together. The module discusses also what SDI are used for, i.e. what are the objectives of a good functioning SDI.. The components and the benefits of an SDI are illustrated using real world examples. The access to SDIs through geoportals is demonstrated. Learners will visit several geoportals and will learn to browse for data.
			The training material consist of presentations, exercises and supporting documents. The module is NOT a self-learning module, but needs class tutoring and interactions.
Language: ['Marc Olijslagers', 'Danny Vandenbroucke', 'Maria da Saudade De Brito Pontes']
Size or Duration: In total the module will take approximately 9h with an average duration of 1.5h per lecture

Title: Management view on Spatial Data Infrastructures
Creator: ['Glenn Vancauwenberghe']
Publisher: SADL, KU Leuven
Abstract:
This module gives an overview of the non-technical aspects related to Spatial Data Infrastructures (SDI). In SDI several technical and non-technical components work together. This module focuses on the non-technical components and is targeting decision makers, managers and process owners.
		The module starts with a general introduction to Spatial Data Infrastructures, followed by several lectures on specific non-technological aspects and components of SDIs. The module looks at the legal framework of SDIs, and the relevance and importance of data policies, and open data policies in particular. It addresses governance and task allocation in the context of SDIs, by explaining the meaning of both concepts and presenting approaches for governing and allocating tasks in the development and implementation of SDIs. The module also looks at SDIs from a process perspective, as processes are key to the development and use of SDIs. The final part of the module deals with the assessment and evaluation of SDIs, i.e. how to measure and manage the performance of SDIs. 
		The training material consist of several presentations. The module is NOT a self-learning module, but needs class tutoring and interactions.

Title: Sentinel-2 data and vegetation indices
Creator: ['Agata Hościło']
Publisher: Institute of Geodesy and Cartography (IGiK)
Abstract: This is a training material on Sentinel-2 data and vegetation indices
Contributors: ['Valerio Tramutoli', 'Nicola Capece', 'Valeria Satriano - University of Basilicata', 'Sara Wiman', 'Greger Lindeberg - Geografiska informationsbyrån']

Title: Introduction to Remote Sensing
Creator: ['Agata Hościło']
Publisher: Institute of Geodesy and Cartography IGIK
Abstract: abstract
Contributors: ['Valerio Tramutoli - University of Basilicata', 'Nicola Capece - University of Basilicata', 'Valeria Satriano - University of Basilicata']

Title: Flood mapping with Synthetic Aperture Radar?
Publisher: University of Jena
Abstract: This presentation gives a basic overview on the use of Earth observation data from Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) systems for flood mapping. It was prepared using partly the EO College materials available at https://eo-college.org/resources/#results
Description: Learning outcomes: Understand the basics of SAR; Understand interaction bewteen SAR signal and water; Plan flood mapping using SAR data;

Title: Change Detection Using EO Data
Creator: ['Ioana-Maria Vlad Sandru']
Publisher: Romanian Space Agency
Abstract: The text provide introductory concepts on detecting changes using EO data. Considerations about quantitative vs qualitative assessment as well as methods and processing steps are also provided
Description: Learning outcomes: Understand how EO satellite data can help detecting changes in different types of environment on Earth

Title: Fundaments of optical remote sensing
Creator: ['Valerio Tramutoli']
Publisher: University of Basilicata
Abstract: This course contains the basic elements of Earth observation from space, dealing with the basic physical principles, technologies and methodologies used. The main objective of the course is to provide students with the foundations for studying the processes and environmental parameters with space technologies.

Title: Programación SIG en entornos Web
Creator: ['Carlos Granell']
Publisher: Universitat Jaume I de Castelló, Spain
Abstract: The programming course introduces the student the basics of the Leaflet library to create simple web-based maps

Title: Reproducibility Research in the Geosciences
Creator: ['Carlos Granell']
Publisher: Universitat Jaume I de Castelló, Spain
Abstract: In this course students will get an introduction to the main ideas and tools to acquire reproducible research practices
Description: Learning outcomes: Apply a series of practices (steps and tasks) for reproducible research in different phases of a project; Plan a reproducibility project independently; Recognize the importance of reproducible research as a fundamental pillar of modern science; Understand the problems associated with the lack of reproducibility
